DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Performed Observation Outcome Reference Object Range Comparison Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded value specifying the relationship of a value to a normal range or reference range of values. EXAMPLE(S): high, low, within normal range, outside normal range.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Performed Observation Outcome Reference Object Range Comparison Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action._Something referred to; the object of a reference.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.:The examination of two or more people or things in order to detect similarities and differences.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.
